** Apologies for cross-posting **



Call for Papers - SWARM INTELLIGENCE J=
OURNAL -

Special Issue on SELF-ORGANIZED CONSTRUCTION



SWARM INTELLIGENC=
E JOURNAL

Editor-in-Chief: Marco Dorigo

Impact Factor (2015): 2.577



Sp=
ecial Issue on SELF-ORGANIZED CONSTRUCTION

http://www.selforganisedconstru=
ction.org



Timeline / Important Deadlines

- Manuscript due: April 15, 20=
17

- Notification: June 30, 2017

- Publication is scheduled for late 2017=




Social insects build nests in a self-organised manner. Large numbers of=
 individuals contribute to the construction not by following a predefined p=
lan but by sensing and reacting to stimuli in their local environment. Rece=
ntly, with the wake of robotic swarms, self-organised construction is quick=
ly gaining significance in the context of various design and construction p=
rocesses. Future development of self-organised construction may also make u=
se of novel material processing approaches (e.g., 3D printing techniques). =
Self-organised construction will play an important role in the design and r=
ealisation of any structure, building, or infrastructure up to the scale of=
 entire cities. Yet, in order to harness its potential, theoretical concept=
s need to be developed and a range of application challenges need to be sol=
ved.



Therefore, we encourage submissions of innovative research work hig=
hlighting the importance of the mechanisms of self-organisation in the cont=
ext of distributed construction.

Topics of interest of this special issue =
include but are not limited to:

- Self-organised biologically inspired con=
struction models

- Analysis and design of construction coordination algori=
thms

- Self-organised robot groups and swarms for construction

- Modellin=
g and simulation techniques, tools and platforms for self-organised constru=
ction

- Agent-based simulations of building construction

- Investigation =
of constraints on macro-level (e.g., building blueprint) and degrees of fre=
edom on the micro-level (e.g., behavioral features of individual agents/rob=
ots)

- Investigation of construction behaviours on different spatio-tempor=
al scales

- Self-organised approaches to construction maintenance

- Compu=
tational metrics for evaluating complex structures built via self-organisat=
ion, such as complexity, energy efficiency, structural integrity of buildin=
gs, etc.

- Interfaces for human inspection and control of self-organised c=
onstruction systems

- Applications of self-organised swarm construction in=
 architectural design, building engineering, landscaping, industrial design=
, and engineering/manufacturing applying methods of self-organization



Gu=
est Editors

- Heiko Hamann, University of Paderborn (heiko.hamann@uni-pade=
rborn.de)

- Sebastian von Mammen, University of W=FCrzburg (sebastian.von.=
mammen@...)

- Ingo Mauser, Karlsruhe Institute of Technology =
(ingo.mauser@...)



Workshop Series

Previously, we organised the "1st=
 International Workshop on Self-Organising Construction" (SOCO) as part of =
the IEEE International Conferences on Self-Adaptive and Self-Organising sys=
tems (SASO) and on Cloud and Autonomic Computing (ICCAC).

You can find mor=
e information about this workshop, including a detailed list of contributio=
ns at http://www.vonmammen.org/soco2016/.



Looking forward to receiving y=
our contributions!



-----------------

Dr. Heiko Hamann

Professor for Sw=
arm Robotics

heiko.hamann@...



University of Paderborn

Hei=
nz Nixdorf Institute

Paderborn, Germany



-----------------

Dr. Sebastia=
n von Mammen

sebastian.von.mammen@...-augsburg.de



University=
 of Augsburg

Organic Computing

Augsburg, Germany



-----------------

In=
go Mauser

ingo.mauser@...



Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT)

=
Institute of Applied Informatics and Formal Description Methods (AIFB)

Kar=
lsruhe, Germany

<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">Social inse=
cts build nests in a self-organised manner. Large numbers of individuals co=
ntribute to the construction not by following a predefined plan but by sens=
ing and reacting to stimuli in their local environment.
 Recently, with the=
 wake of robotic swarms, self-organised construction is quickly gaining sig=
nificance in the context of various design and construction processes. Futu=
re development of self-organised construction may also make use of novel ma=
terial processing
 approaches (e.g., 3D printing techniques). Self-organise=
d construction will play an important role in the design and realisation of=
 any structure, building, or infrastructure up to the scale of entire citie=
s. Yet, in order to harness its potential, theoretical
 concepts need to be=
 developed and a range of application challenges need to be solved.<o:p></o=
:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US"><o:p> </=
o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">Therefore, w=
e encourage submissions of innovative research work highlighting the import=
ance of the mechanisms of self-organisation in the context of distributed c=
onstruction.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"=
EN-US">Topics of interest of this special issue include but are not limited=
 to:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">-=
 Self-organised biologically inspired construction models<o:p></o:p></span>=
</p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">- Analysis and design o=
f construction coordination algorithms<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"Ms=
oPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">- Self-organised robot groups and swarms f=
or construction<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=
=3D"EN-US">- Modelling and simulation techniques, tools and platforms for s=
elf-organised construction<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText">=
<span lang=3D"EN-US">- Agent-based simulations of building construction<o:p=
></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">- Investi=
gation of constraints on macro-level (e.g., building blueprint) and degrees=
 of freedom on the micro-level (e.g., behavioral features of individual age=
nts/robots)<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"E=
N-US">- Investigation of construction behaviours on different spatio-tempor=
al scales<o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-=
US">- Self-organised approaches to construction maintenance<o:p></o:p></spa=
n></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">- Computational metri=
cs for evaluating complex structures built via self-organisation, such as c=
omplexity, energy efficiency, structural integrity of buildings, etc.<o:p><=
/o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">- Interface=
s for human inspection and control of self-organised construction systems<o=
:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">- Appli=
cations of self-organised swarm construction in architectural design, build=
ing engineering, landscaping, industrial design, and engineering/manufactur=
ing applying methods of self-organization<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">Previously, we organised =

<p class=3D"MsoPlainText"><span lang=3D"EN-US">You=
